member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IDialogs
member.summary: The browser dialogs.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IDialogs.OpenDirectoryHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the browser requests to display a file chooser dialog to open a directory.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: You can use this handler to display the directory chooser dialog, or provide the chosen directory without displaying any dialogs.
Use the method to provide the selected directory to the browser.
Use the method to cancel the dialog.
If the handler throws an exception, the method will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IDialogs.OpenExternalAppHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the currently loaded web page wants to open a link in the associated external application.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: You can display your own dialog with the localized message that you can get from the parameters.

Use the method to tell the browser that the link should be opened in the associated external application. If the application is not running, the operating system should launch the application and open the link in it.
If the handler throws an exception, the method will be invoked.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IDialogs.OpenFileHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the browser requests to display a file chooser dialog to open a file.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: You can use this handler to display the file chooser, or provide the file without displaying any dialogs.
Use the method to provide the selected file to the browser.
Use the method to cancel the dialog.
If the handler throws an exception, the method will be invoked.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IDialogs.OpenMultipleFilesHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the browser requests to display a file chooser dialog to open several files.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: You can use this handler to display the file chooser, or provide the files without displaying any dialogs.
Use the method to provide the selected files to the browser.
Use the method to cancel the dialog.
If the handler throws an exception, the method will be invoked.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IDialogs.RepostFormHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when a web page with POST data is going to be reloaded and the user must confirm that the POST data can be resubmitted.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: You can use this handler to display a confirmation dialog where you ask the user whether the web page can be reloaded or not.
Use the method to allow resubmitting POST data.
Use the method to cancel the page reloading.
If the handler throws an exception, the method method will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IDialogs.SaveAsPdfHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the browser requests to display a file chooser dialog to save content as PDF.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: You can use this handler to display the save dialog, or provide the full file path without displaying any dialogs.
Use the method to provide the selected files to the browser.
Use the method to cancel the dialog.
If the handler throws an exception, the method will be invoked.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IDialogs.SelectColorHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the user clicks an <input type='color'> HTML5 element.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: You can use this handler to display your own color chooser dialog or set the required color programmatically without displaying any dialogs.
Use the method to provide the selected color to the browser.
Use the method to cancel the dialog.
If the handler throws an exception, the method will be invoked.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IJsDialogs
member.summary: The JavaScript dialogs.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IJsDialogs.AlertHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when JavaScript alert dialog should be displayed.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: In this callback you can display standard modal dialog with the message that you can get from .
Please note that it is not necessary to display a dialog in this handler.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IJsDialogs.BeforeUnloadHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the web page is about to be unloaded.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: Some web pages may override the window.onbeforeunload JavaScript function, so that a confirmation dialog will be shown every time when the user tries to reload a web page or navigate to another web page. You can use this callback to display an appropriate confirmation message dialog to ask the user if they really want to leave or reload the web page. To find out whether the web page is going to be reloaded you can check the property.
Use the method to stay on the current web page.
Use the method to reload or navigate to another web page.
If the handler throws an exception, the method will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IJsDialogs.ConfirmHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when JavaScript confirmation dialog should be displayed.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: In this handler you can display standard modal dialog with the message that you can get from . Please note that it is not necessary to display a dialog in this handler.
Use the to notify that the JavaScript dialog is closed with the "OK" action.
Use the method to dismiss the dialog.
If the handler throws an exception, the method will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.Dialogs.IJsDialogs.PromptHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when JavaScript dialog prompting the user to input some text should be displayed.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: The passed object contains the text of the prompt message and the default response text. You can use this information to display standard modal dialog to obtain a prompt response from user. Please note that it is not necessary to display a dialog in this callback.
Use the method to close the dialog and pass the text value passed as a parameter to the engine.
Use the method to cancel the dialog.
If the callback throws an exception, the method will be used.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser
member.summary: A web browser control that allows loading a web page or a local HTML file, accessing DOM and executing JavaScript on the loaded web page, getting notifications about loading progress, dispatching keyboard and mouse events, etc.

remarks.para: The IBrowser instance itself is running in a separate native process that allocates memory and system resources that must be released. So, when a IBrowser instance is no longer needed, it must be disposed through the method to release all the allocated memory and system resources. For example:
Any attempt to use an already disposed IBrowser instance will lead to the .

The IBrowser instance is disposed automatically when its IEngine is disposed or unexpectedly crashed. If the instance represents a popup window created by JavaScript via the window.open() function, then JavaScript can close the instance using the window.close() function.
To get notifications that the IBrowser instance has been disposed please subscribe to the following event:

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.AllFrames
member.summary: Gets all the frames on the currently loaded web page.
member.value: All the frames on the currently loaded web page. If the current browser did not load any web pages, this will be an empty collection.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

member.value: The instance associated with this .

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the browser size.
member.value: The browser size. By default, browser's size is empty.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: Setting this property updates the size of this Browser instance with the given width and height. Many web pages rely on the Browser's size and require that it's not empty. DOM document of a web page might not be loaded and displayed at all, because there's no sense in loading and rendering DOM document when it's empty.

As a result, you should set the browser size programmatically when you don't need to display content of the loaded web page, but the web page must "think" it has been loaded in a browser instance with a non-empty size.

member.value: The instance associated with this .

member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.UpdateBoundsRequested
member.summary: Occurs when JavaScript requests to update bounds of the Browser instance.
member.remarks:
JavaScript can request to update bounds of the Browser instance through the following JavaScript functions:
window.moveTo()
moves a window to the specified position.
window.moveBy()
moves a window a specified number of pixels relative to its current coordinates.
window.resizeTo()
resizes the window to the specified width and height.
window.resizeBy()
resizes the window by the specified pixels.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.DisposeAsync(DotNetBrowser.Browser.BrowserDisposeOptions)
member.summary: Asynchronously disposes the current browser instance according to the given options.
member.param: browser dispose options.
member.returns: The task that represents the result of the asynchronous dispose process. True indicates that the browser instance is successfully disposed without any dialogs, false if the dispose process was canceled. This may happen if the handler was invoked and the response was sent.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: If the currently loaded web page registers the onbeforeunload JavaScript event and the given options tell the browser to fire the beforeunload event, then this method will not dispose the browser right away.
The will be invoked in this case and if the handler tells the browser to stay on the web page, then the browser will not be disposed.
The following example demonstrates how to dispose the browser instance as if a user manually clicking the close button of the tab/window.
If the browser is already disposed, then this method does nothing.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.Focus
member.summary: Tells the browser that it has focus and must be activated.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.ReplaceMisspelledWord(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces misspelled word under cursor on the currently loaded web page with the given . If there is no misspelled word under cursor, this method does nothing.
member.param: a string that represents the word for replacement
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.
The is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.SaveWebPage(System.String,System.String,DotNetBrowser.Browser.SavePageType)
member.summary: Initiates the saving process of the currently loaded web page. The web page can be saved as a single HTML file or the file with resources. Before saving a web page make sure that it is not being loaded. It is recommended to completely loaded the web page and only then save it.
member.param: an absolute path to a file in which the web page will be saved.
an absolute path to a directory in which the resources (e.g. images, css) of the web page will be saved. If the directory does not exist, it will be created
determines how the web page will be saved: as an HTML file with all the required resources (e.g. images, css etc.), a single HTML or MHTML file
member.returns: true if the saving process has been initialized successfully, false otherwise.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.
The is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
The is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.TakeImage
member.summary: Creates and returns an image of the currently loaded web page.
member.returns: a that contains the image of the currently loaded web page.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

remarks.para: The bitmap size depends on the size of the current browser instance and the device scale factor of the display where it is located at the moment. If the current browser size is empty, then the bitmap will be empty as well.

For example, if the device scale factor of the display where the browser instance is located at the moment is 2.0 and the browser size is 100x100, then the size of the bitmap is expected to be 200x200.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.Unfocus
member.summary: Tells the browser that it does not have focus and must be deactivated.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.ShowContextMenuHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the browser should show a context menu.

remarks.para: The passed object contains information about the context menu to show.
Use the method to close the context menu without choice.
Use the method to choose the context menu item.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.SelectCertificateHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the web server requires authorization via client certificate.

remarks.para: The object contains information about the authorization request.
To access the list of the certificates from the system storage that match the server criteria you can use the property.

You can use this handler to display a dialog with the list of the available certificates that allows the user to select the required certificate. Please note that it is not necessary to display a dialog in this handler.
This handler itself is never called on the UI thread directly.
Use the method to cancel the authorization.
Use the method to inform the browser to use the client certificate located by the passed index in the certificate list.
Use the method to inform the browser to use the specified client certificate.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.CreatePopupHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the browser decides whether a new popup instance can be created or not.

remarks.para: Use the method to let the browser to create a new popup.
Use the method to suppress popup.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.
Important: the engine will be blocked until you return control from the callback.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.InjectCssHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the document element has been created and a custom stylesheet can be injected into the document.

remarks.para: Use the method to inject a custom stylesheet into the document.
Use the method to continue loading without injecting.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.
Important: the engine will be blocked until you return control from the callback.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.InjectJsHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the document element has been created and a custom JavaScript can be injected into the document.

remarks.para:
When the property is set, you can call methods of the injected .NET object from JavaScript:
window.myObject.SayHelloTo('John');
This handler may be invoked several times for the same frame.

Important: you should avoid executing a JavaScript code that modifies the DOM tree of the web page being loaded.You must not use DotNetBrowser DOM API to remove the frame for which this callback is invoked, otherwise the render process will crash.
Important: the engine will be blocked until you return control from the callback.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.OpenPopupHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when a new popup browser instance should be opened.

remarks.para: Important: the engine will be blocked until you return control from the callback.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.RequestPrintHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the printing is initiated.

remarks.para: In this callback you can cancel or allow showing print preview dialog, or print the content programmatically.
By default, the printing is canceled if there is no browser view initialized from the browser.
Use the method to show the print preview.
Use the method to continue printing and configure it programmatically in and .
Use the method to cancel printing.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.
Important: do not use if the browser is not displayed. In this case, the dialog will not be visible - as a result, the end user will not be able to close it or confirm printing.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.PrintHtmlContentHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the HTML content printing is initiated.

remarks.para: In this callback you can configure the print settings. The workflow is the following:

item.value: Find the required printer using the interface. You can obtain an instance of Printers using the property.
Get the current from the printer.
Configure the required settings for the print job using the interface provided by the property.
Apply the configured settings using the method.
Tell the browser to proceed with the printing using the configured settings: .

remarks.para: Use the method to continue printing using the selected printer.
Use the method to cancel printing.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.
If printing is initiated when the browser is loading a web page, this callback is not invoked.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.PrintPdfContentHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the PDF content printing is initiated.

remarks.para: In this callback you can configure the print settings. The workflow is the following:

item.value: Find the required printer using the interface. You can obtain an instance of Printers using the property.
Get the current from the printer.
Configure the required settings for the print job using the interface provided by the property.
Apply the configured settings using the method.
Tell the browser to proceed with the printing using the configured settings: .

remarks.para: Use the method to continue printing using the selected printer.
Use the method to cancel printing.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.
If printing is initiated when the browser is loading a web page, this callback is not invoked.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Browser.IBrowser.StartDownloadHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the browser is about to start downloading the file.

remarks.para: Use the method to confirm the download and specify the location to store the downloaded file.
Use the method if you do not need to download the file.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.

remarks.para: By default, the size of the browser is empty.Many web pages rely on the browser size and require that it is not empty. The DOM document of a web page might not be loaded and displayed at all, because there is no sense in loading and rendering DOM document when it is empty.
Use this method when you do not need to display content of the loaded web page, but the web page must "think" it has been loaded in a browser instance with a non-empty size.

The widget location inside its parent window.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Cache.Events.DiskCacheClearedEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments for the event.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Cache.Events.DiskCacheClearedEventArgs.HttpCache
member.summary: The instance associated with the event.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Cache.IHttpCache
member.summary: An HTTP cache service.

remarks.para: By default, HTTP cache stores the resources fetched from the web on a disk or in the memory. Chromium itself decides how to cache the resources for optimal performance.
The memory cache stores and loads the resources to and from the process memory (RAM). It is a fast, but non-persistent way.
The disk cache is persistent. The cached resources are stored and loaded to and from the disk. The disk cache is stored in the HttpCache folder in the User Data directory.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Cache.IHttpCache.Engine
member.summary: The instance associated with this object.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Cache.IHttpCache.DiskCacheCleared
member.summary: Occurs when the disk cache has been cleared.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Cache.IHttpCache.Clear
member.summary: Marks all the cache entries for deletion. The deletion of the entries is performed asynchronously by the Chromium engine itself. If the engine is closed during this task executing - the operation will be canceled.
member.returns: a which is completed when the disk cache is cleared.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Cache.IHttpCache.ClearDiskCache
member.summary: Marks all entries in the disk cache for deletion. The deletion of the entries is performed asynchronously by the Chromium engine itself. This method is obsolete with version 2.2 and above. Use instead.
member.returns: a which is completed when the disk cache is cleared.

member.summary: Gets the HttpOnly attribute value of the cookie. The HttpOnly cookie attribute can help to mitigate hijacking and XSS attacks by preventing access to cookie value through JavaScript.
member.value: The HttpOnly attribute value.

member.summary: Gets the Secure attribute value of the cookie. A secure cookie is only sent to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.
member.value: The Secure attribute value.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.Cookie.IsSession
member.summary: Indicates whether this cookie is a session cookie without expiration time.
member.value: true if this cookie is a session cookie without expiration time, false if this cookie is a persistent cookie that has expiration time.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.Cookie.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the cookie.
member.value: The cookie's name.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.Cookie.Path
member.summary: Gets the path on the server to which the browser returns this cookie. The cookie is visible to all sub-paths on the server.
member.value: The path on the server, for example, /catalog.

remarks.para: Path indicates a URL path that must exist in the requested URL in order to send the Cookie header. The %x2F ("/") character is considered a directory separator, and subdirectories will match as well.

For example, if Path=/docs is set, these paths will match:
/docs
/docs/Web/
/docs/Web/HTTP

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.Cookie.SameSite
member.summary: Gets the SameSite attribute value of the cookie. This attribute denotes if your cookie is restricted to a first-party or same-site context.
member.value: The SameSite attribute value.

remarks.para: By default, the attribute value is set to which means cookies are only set when the domain in the URL of the browser matches the domain of the cookie a first-party cookie.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.Cookie.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the cookie.
member.value: The cookie's value.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.ICookieStore
member.summary: The system for storing and retrieving cookies. The cookies can be stored in the process memory (session cookies) or in files (persistent cookies). The instance provides access to both session and persistent cookies.

remarks.para: The persistent cookies are stored in the Browser cache directory.
So, if Browser A and B have the same cache directory, then they will access the cookies of each other.

If you need to configure each Browser to use unique cookie storage which is not accessible for other Browser instances, you need to provide unique user data directory for each Browser instance. The user data directory path can be provided via configured object that must be passed into the EngineFactory.Create method.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.ICookieStore.Engine
member.summary: The instance associated with this object.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.ICookieStore.Delete(DotNetBrowser.Cookies.Cookie)
member.summary: Deletes one specific cookie. The cookie instance can be received from a list of cookies returned from the method.
member.param: cookie to delete.
member.returns: true when cookie was deleted successfully.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.ICookieStore.DeleteAllCookies
member.summary: Deletes all of the cookies including session, secure or HTTP only cookies.
member.returns: The number of deleted cookies.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.ICookieStore.Flush
member.summary: Use this method to save all the changes you apply to this cookie storage. By default all the changes to the cookie store are made in memory, so when you restart the application you will not see the changes you made if you don't invoke this method on application exit. You can invoke this method after every change you made to cookie storage.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.ICookieStore.GetAllCookies(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all the cookies for given url including HTTP only cookies.
member.param: The URL associated with the returned cookies.
member.returns: The collection of all the cookies or an empty collection when there's no cookies.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.ICookieStore.SetCookie(System.String,DotNetBrowser.Cookies.Cookie)
member.summary: Sets a session cookie given explicit user-provided cookie attributes and associate it with the given .
member.param: A valid URL, which host will be associated with a new cookie instance. The url string must be valid and has the following format: http[https]://host. For example, http://www.google.com, https://www.gmail.com etc.
An HTTP cookie.
member.exception: The is null, or the is null, empty, or contains blank characters.
member.returns: true when session cookie was inserted successfully, false otherwise.
member.remarks:
If and are different, the cookie will not be set and the method returns false. So, make sure that and cookie domain are the same domains. For example, for http://www.teamdev.com address the cookie domain must be .teamdev.com
If you set the cookie successfully and the method returns true and you decide to find the cookie in the list of all cookies, please note that the cookie storage can modify some cookies attributes, such as domain or expiration time.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.SameSite
member.summary: The SameSite cookie attribute values of the Set-Cookie HTTP response header. This attribute is used to declare in which context the cookies can be sent.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.SameSite.Unspecified
member.summary: Reserved value.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.SameSite.StrictMode
member.summary: The cookie can only be sent in a first-party context, when the cookie matches the domain of the current site.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.SameSite.LaxMode
member.summary: The cookie can be sent with top-level navigations from a third-party site to the web site with the domain matching the cookie. This is the default value in modern browsers.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Cookies.SameSite.None
member.summary: The cookie can be sent in a third-party context. To use this mode the cookie must also be marked as secure.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.DevTools.IDevTools
member.summary: Allows working with Chromium Developer Tools and access the remote debugging URL of the currently loaded web page in the browser instance associated with this DevTools instance.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.DevTools.IDevTools.RemoteDebuggingUrl
member.summary: Gets the remote debugging URL of the currently loaded web page in the browser instance associated with this DevTools instance.
member.value: The remote debugging URL. Can be null if the remote debugging URL is not available, for instance, when the instance has not been configured with the remote debugging port.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.AlignTo
member.summary: Represents the values that can be used to describe how the element will be aligned to the visible area of the scrollable ancestor.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.AlignTo.Top
member.summary: The top of the element will be aligned to the top of the visible area of the scrollable ancestor.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.AlignTo.Bottom
member.summary: The bottom of the element will be aligned to the bottom of the visible area of the scrollable ancestor.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.DocumentPosition
member.summary: Enumeration of the document position that represent the relationship between two nodes within the Document.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.DocumentPosition.Unspecified
member.summary: The position is not specified.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.DocumentPosition.Disconnected
member.summary: The nodes are disconnected.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.DocumentPosition.Preceding
member.summary: The position of the other node precedes the position of the reference node.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.DocumentPosition.Following
member.summary: The position of the other node follows the position of the reference node.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.DocumentPosition.Contains
member.summary: The reference node contains the other node.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.DocumentPosition.ContainedBy
member.summary: The other node contains the reference node.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.DocumentPosition.ImplementationSpecific
member.summary: The node positions depend on the DOM implementation and cannot be compared.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.Event
member.summary: Represents a DOM event that can be handled on the .NET side.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.Event.EventType
member.summary: Gets the DOM event type.
member.value: The DOM event type.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.Event.UseCapture
member.summary: Indicates if capturing is used for the DOM event.

remarks.para: If capturing is used, all events of the specified type will be dispatched to the registered listeners before being dispatched to any event target beneath them in the tree.
Events which are bubbling upward through the tree will not trigger the listeners in this case.

member.value: true if capturing is used, false otherwise.

member.summary: Occurs when the corresponding DOM event is received.

the event handler to register for this DOM event.
member.returns: The updated instance.

member.summary: The overloaded operator that can be used for simplifying registering event handlers for the DOM event.
member.param: The custom DOM event.

member.returns: The updated instance.

member.summary: Gets the type of this DOM event.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvent.PreventDefault

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents
member.summary: A collection of custom DOM events that can be listened and/or handled.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Item(DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.EventType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom DOM event to listen.
member.param: The event type to listen.

if true, indicates that the user wishes to initiate capture. After initiating capture, all events of the specified type will be dispatched to the registered listeners before being dispatched to any event target beneath them in the tree. Events which are bubbling upward through the tree will not trigger the listeners in this case.
member.value: The object that can be used to listen to the custom DOM event.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Click
member.summary: Occurs when the user clicks on an element.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.DoubleClick
member.summary: Occurs when the user double-clicks on an element.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.MouseDown
member.summary: Occurs when the user presses a mouse button over an element.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.MouseUp
member.summary: Occurs when a user releases a mouse button over an element.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Occurs when the pointer is moved onto an element, or onto one of its children.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.MouseMove
member.summary: Occurs when the pointer is moving while it is over an element.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Occurs when a user moves the mouse pointer out of an element, or out of one of its children

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.KeyDown
member.summary: Occurs when the user presses a key.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.KeyUp
member.summary: Occurs when the user releases a key.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.KeyPress
member.summary: Occurs when the user presses a key that produces a character value.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Load
member.summary: Occurs when an object has loaded.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Unload
member.summary: Occurs once a page has unloaded (for <body>).

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Abort
member.summary: Occurs when the loading of a resource has been aborted.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Error
member.summary: Occurs when an error occurs while loading an external file.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Resize
member.summary: Occurs when the document view is resized.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Scroll
member.summary: Occurs when an element's scrollbar is being scrolled.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Select
member.summary: Occurs after the user selects some text (for <input> and <textarea>).

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Change
member.summary: Occurs when the content of a form element, the selection, or the checked state have changed (for <input>, <select>, and <textarea>).

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Submit
member.summary: Occurs when a form is submitted.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvents.Reset
member.summary: Occurs when a form is reset.

member.summary: Occurs when an element loses focus.

member.summary: Occurs when user scrolls a mouse wheel over an element.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEventTarget
member.summary: This interface is implemented by all implementations to support DOM event model.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEventTarget.Events
member.summary: Gets the DOM events that can be listened.
member.value: The DOM events that can be listened.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEventTarget.DispatchEvent(DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IEvent)
member.summary: Dispatches (sends) a particular DOM event to the current target.
member.param: The DOM event to dispatch
member.returns: false if event is cancelable and at least one of the event handlers which handled this event called cancelable action; true otherwise.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IKeyEvent
member.summary:
Represents a keyboard event and provides an access to specific keyboard event data.
This event occurs when a user performs some keyboard action, for example presses or releases a keyboard key.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IKeyEvent.Character
member.summary: Gets the character generated by pressing the key.
member.value: The character generated by pressing the key.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IKeyEvent.KeyCode
member.summary: Gets the key code that represents a physical key on the keyboard.
member.value: The key code. If the key can't be identified, returns .

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IMouseEvent
member.summary:
Represents a mouse event and provides an access to specific mouse event data.
This event occurs when a user performs an action with a pointing device (such as a mouse), for example moves the mouse or clicks a mouse button.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IMouseEvent.Button
member.summary: Gets the button which was pressed on the mouse to trigger the event.
member.value: The mouse button which was pressed to trigger the event.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IMouseEvent.ClickCount
member.summary: Gets the click count.
member.value: the count of consecutive clicks that happened in a short amount of time for mouse events, such as click, mouseDown, mouseUp. For all other UI events returns 0.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IMouseEvent.ClientLocation
member.summary: Gets the location of the mouse cursor in the local (DOM content) coordinate system at the time the event occurred.
member.value: The location of the mouse cursor.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IMouseEvent.OffsetLocation
member.summary: Gets the location of the mouse cursor in the component's coordinate system at the time the event occurred.
member.value: The location of the mouse cursor.

remarks.para: For example, clicking in the top-left corner of the client area will always result in that the X field of the result equals 0, regardless of whether the page is scrolled horizontally.
This API is available since DotNetBrowser 2.1.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IMouseEvent.ScreenLocation
member.summary: Gets the location of the mouse cursor in the screen's coordinate system at the time the event occurred.
member.value: The location of the mouse cursor.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IUiKeyEventModifier
member.summary:
Represents a DOM UI event that can be fired with the key modifiers.
The provides access to the data about pressed service keys, such as Ctrl, Alt, Shift, Meta, when a keyboard or mouse event occurs.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IUiKeyEventModifier.KeyModifiers
member.summary: Gets the key modifiers that are applied to the event.
member.value: The key modifiers that are applied to the event.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IWheelEvent
member.summary:
A wheel event that provides access to the wheel event data.
This event occurs when a user rotates a wheel on a pointing device (such as a mouse).

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IWheelEvent.DeltaMode
member.summary: Gets the delta units type.
member.value: The delta units type used, e.g. pixels, lines, or pages.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IWheelEvent.DeltaX
member.summary: Gets the amount of units to scroll horizontally.
member.value: The amount of units to scroll horizontally.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.IWheelEvent.DeltaY
member.summary: Gets the amount of units to scroll vertically.
member.value: The amount of units to scroll vertically.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.KeyEventParameters
member.summary: Represents the DOM keyboard event parameters.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.KeyEventParameters.Character
member.summary: Gets or sets the character generated by pressing the key.
member.value: The character generated by pressing the key.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.KeyEventParameters.KeyCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the key code of the pressed key.
member.value: The key code of the pressed key.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.KeyEventParameters.UiEventModifierParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the DOM UI event parameters with the key modifiers.
member.value: The DOM UI event parameters with the key modifiers.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.MouseEventParameters
member.summary: Represents the DOM mouse event parameters.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.MouseEventParameters.Button
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of the mouse button that was pressed to trigger the event.
member.value:
The number of the mouse button that was pressed to trigger the event:
0 - Main button pressed, usually the left button or the uninitialized state
1 - Auxiliary button pressed, usually the wheel button or the middle button (if present)
2 - Secondary button pressed, usually the right button
3 - Fourth button, typically the Browser Back button
4 - Fifth button, typically the Browser Forward button

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.Events.MouseEventParameters.ClickCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the click count.
member.value: the count of consecutive clicks that happened in a short amount of time for mouse events, such as click, mouseDown, mouseUp. For all other UI events it is equal to 0.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.IElement.BoundingClientRect
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the element and its position relative to the top-left of the viewport of the current document.
member.value: The bounds of the element and its position relative to the top-left of the viewport of the current document.

remarks.para: The amount of scrolling that has been done of the viewport area (or any other scrollable element) is taken into account when computing the bounding rectangle. This means that the rectangle's boundary edges (top, left, bottom, and right) change their values every time the scrolling position changes (because their values are relative to the viewport and not absolute). If you need the bounding rectangle relative to the top-left corner of the document, just add the current scrolling position to the top and left properties (these can be obtained using window.scrollX and window.scrollY) to get a bounding rectangle which is independent from the current scrolling position.

member.value: The bounds of the element and its position relative to the top-left of the viewport of the current document.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Dom.INode.TextContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the text content of the node and its descendants.

remarks.para: Setting this property on a node removes all of its children and replaces them with a single text node with the given value.
The property value depends on the type of the node, whhich can be checked via the property.
The property value is an empty string if the element is a document, a document type, or a notation.
If the node is a CDATA section, a comment, a processing instruction, or a text node, this method returns the text inside this node (the ).

For other node types, this method returns the concatenation of the TextContent attribute value of every child node, excluding comments and processing instruction nodes. This is an empty string if the node has no children.

Differences from InnerText:
The TextContent property gets the content of all elements, including <script> and <style > elements, and the mostly equivalent InnerText property does not.
InnerText is also aware of style and will not return the text of hidden elements, whereas TextContent will.
As InnerText is aware of CSS styling, it will trigger a reflow, whereas TextContent will not.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType
member.summary: Represents the XPath result types.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.Unspecified
member.summary: The result type is not set. Possibly, the evaluation error occurred.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.Any
member.summary: The result type is not set. In this case the type is a natural type of the evaluation result.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.Number
member.summary: The result contains a single number.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.String
member.summary: The result contains a single string.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.Boolean
member.summary: The result contains a single boolean value.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.UnorderedNodeIterator
member.summary: The result represents a set of all nodes matching the XPath expression. The order of nodes in the result is not defined.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.OrderedNodeIterator
member.summary: The result represents a set of all nodes matching the XPath expression. The nodes in the result are in the same order that they appear in the document.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.UnorderedNodeSnapshot
member.summary: The result represents the snapshots of all nodes matching the XPath expression. The order of the nodes in the result is not defined.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.OrderedNodeSnapshot
member.summary: The result represents the snapshots of all nodes matching the XPath expression. The nodes in the result are in the same order that they appear in the document.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.AnyUnorderedNode
member.summary: The result represents a single node matching the XPath expression. The node is not necessarily the first node in the document that matches the expression.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.FirstOrderedNode
member.summary: The result represents the first node in the document matching the XPath expression.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason
member.summary: Possible download interruption reason.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.Unknown
member.summary: There is no interruption reason.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileFailed
member.summary: Generic file operation failure. "File Error".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileAccessDenied
member.summary: The file cannot be accessed due to security restrictions. "Access Denied".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileNoSpace
member.summary: There is not enough room on the drive. "Disk Full".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileNameTooLong
member.summary: The directory or file name is too long. "Path Too Long".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileTooLarge
member.summary: The file is too large for the file system to handle. "File Too Large".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileVirusInfected
member.summary: The file contains a virus. "Virus".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileTransientError
member.summary: The file was in use. Too many files are opened at once. We have run out of memory. "Temporary Problem".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileBlocked
member.summary: The file was blocked due to local policy. "Blocked"

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileSecurityCheckFailed
member.summary: An attempt to check the safety of the download failed due to unexpected reasons. See http:///crbug.com/153212.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileTooShort
member.summary: An attempt was made to seek past the end of a file in opening a file (as part of resuming a previously interrupted download).

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileHashMismatch
member.summary: The partial file didn't match the expected hash.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.FileSameAsSource
member.summary: The source and the target of the download were the same

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.NetworkFailed
member.summary: Generic network failure. "Network Error".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.NetworkTimeout
member.summary: The network operation timed out. "Operation Timed Out".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.NetworkDisconnected
member.summary: The network connection has been lost. "Connection Lost".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.NetworkServerDown
member.summary: The server has gone down. "Server Down".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.NetworkInvalidRequest
member.summary: The network request was invalid. This may be due to the original URL or a redirected URL: - Having an unsupported scheme. - Being an invalid URL. - Being disallowed by policy.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.ServerFailed
member.summary: The server indicates that the operation has failed (generic). "Server Error".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.ServerNoRange
member.summary: The server does not support range requests. Internal use only: must restart from the beginning.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.ServerBadContent
member.summary: The server does not have the requested data. "Unable to get file".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.ServerUnauthorized
member.summary: Server didn't authorize access to resource.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.ServerCertProblem
member.summary: Server certificate problem.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.ServerForbidden
member.summary: Server access forbidden.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.ServerUnreachable
member.summary: Unexpected server response. This might indicate that the responding server may not be the intended server.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.ServerContentLengthMismatch
member.summary: The server sent fewer bytes than the content-length header. It may indicate that the connection was closed prematurely, or the Content-Length header was invalid. The download is only interrupted if strong validators are present. Otherwise, it is treated as finished.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.UserCanceled
member.summary: The user canceled the download. "Canceled".

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.UserShutdown
member.summary: The user shut down the browser. Internal use only: resume pending downloads if possible.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Downloads.Events.DownloadInterruptionReason.Crash
member.summary: The browser crashed. Internal use only: resume pending downloads if possible.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions
member.summary: The options that are used to configure instances.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.BinariesExtractionOptions
member.summary: Gets the options that are used to configure the Chromium binaries extraction process.
member.value: The options that are used to configure the Chromium binaries extraction process.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.ChromiumDirectory
member.summary: Gets the absolute path to the directory where the Chromium binaries are located.
member.value: The absolute path to the directory where the Chromium binaries are located or an empty string if it was not set.

remarks.para: If the directory contains the Chromium binaries, the library will check them and make sure that they are compatible with the current library version. If the directory does not contain the Chromium binaries, or the binaries aren't compatible with the current library version, the library will search for the binaries inside the assemblies from the application references and working directory and extract them into the given directory programmatically. It might take some time to extract the Chromium binaries from a JAR archive. The time depends on the hardware (CPU and SSD/HDD) performance.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.ChromiumSwitches
member.summary: Gets an immutable collection of the Chromium switches that will be passed to the Chromium Main process.
member.value: An immutable collection of the Chromium switches that will be passed to the Chromium Main process.

remarks.para: The library does not support all the possible Chromium switches, so there is no guarantee that the passed switches will work. The switches from this list will overwrite the corresponding options configured through the .
For example, if you configure the remote debugging port using the property and then add the --remote-debugging-port switch using the property, then the port from the switch will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.CrashDumpDirectory
member.summary: Gets the path that will be used to store the automatically generated Chromium crash dumps.
member.value: The path that will be used to store the automatically generated Chromium crash dumps.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.DiskCacheSize
member.summary: Gets the disk cache size.
member.value: The disk cache size in bytes.
member.remarks: If the disk cache size was not set, then it will be calculated automatically. The size depends on the available disk space in the volume where the disk cache is located.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.GoogleApiKey
member.summary: Gets the Google API key.
member.value: The Google API key.

remarks.para: Some Chromium features such as Geolocation, Spelling, Speech, etc. use Google APIs, and to access those APIs, an API Key, OAuth 2.0 client ID, and client secret are required. Setting up API keys is optional. If you do not do it, the specific APIs using Google services won't work.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.GoogleDefaultClientId
member.summary: Gets the Google client ID.
member.value: The Google client ID.

remarks.para: Some Chromium features such as Geolocation, Spelling, Speech, etc. use Google APIs, and to access those APIs, an API Key, OAuth 2.0 client ID, and client secret are required. Setting up API keys is optional. If you do not do it, the specific APIs using Google services won't work.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.GoogleDefaultClientSecret
member.summary: Gets the Google client secret.
member.value: The Google client secret.

remarks.para: Some Chromium features such as Geolocation, Spelling, Speech, etc. use Google APIs, and to access those APIs, an API Key, OAuth 2.0 client ID, and client secret are required. Setting up API keys is optional. If you do not do it, the specific APIs using Google services won't work.

member.value: true if the incognito mode is enabled, false otherwise.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Language
member.summary: Gets the Chromium language that is used on the default error pages and message dialogs.
member.value: The Chromium language.

remarks.para: By default, the language is dynamically configured according to the default locale of the application. If the list of supported languages does not contain the language obtained from the application locale, then the US English language is used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets the license key.
member.value: The license key.
member.remarks: The license key can be set via adding the "dotnetbrowser.license" file as embedded resource or individually for every using the property.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.PasswordStore
member.summary: Gets the password store type which specifies the storage backend should be used to encrypt cookies.
member.value: The password store type.
member.remarks: If the password store type was not set, then the encryption storage backend is chosen by Chromium engine automatically.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.ProprietaryFeatures
member.summary: Gets the proprietary features enabled for the instance.
member.value: The proprietary features enabled for the instance.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.RemoteDebuggingPort
member.summary: Gets the remote debugging port.
member.value: The remote debugging port.

remarks.para: This option enables remote debugging over HTTP at the specific port. When remote debugging is enabled, you can navigate to the http://localhost:<port> address from another Browser instance or from the Google Chrome browser and debug the loaded web pages using Chrome DevTools. If you use Google Chrome browser for remote debugging, its version must be equal to the Chromium engine version that is used in DotNetBrowser.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.RenderingMode
member.summary: Gets the rendering mode indicating how the content of the web pages will be rendered.
member.value: The rendering mode.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Schemes
member.summary: Gets the readonly dictionary of the schemes that will be intercepted.
member.value: The readonly dictionary of the schemes that will be intercepted.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets the custom user agent string that is used to override the default user agent for the .
member.value: The custom user agent string.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.UserDataDirectory
member.summary: Gets an absolute path to the directory where the user data is stored.
member.value: An absolute path to the directory where the user data is stored.

remarks.para: The user data directory stores the data such as cache, cookies, history, GPU cache, local storage, visited links, web data, spell checking dictionary files, etc.
Important: the user data directory cannot be used at the same time by multiple instances running in a single or different applications.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.ChromiumDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute path to the directory where Chromium binaries are located or the empty string if it was not set.
member.value: The absolute path to the directory where Chromium binaries are located or the empty string if it was not set.

remarks.para: If the directory contains the Chromium binaries, the library will check them and make sure that they are compatible with the current library version. If the directory does not contain the Chromium binaries, or the binaries aren't compatible with the current library version, the library will search for the binaries inside the assemblies from the application references and working directory and extract them into the given directory programmatically. It might take some time to extract the Chromium binaries from a JAR archive. The time depends on the hardware (CPU and SSD/HDD) performance.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.ChromiumSwitches
member.summary: Gets a set of the Chromium switches that will be passed to the Chromium Main process.
member.value: A set of the Chromium switches that will be passed to the Chromium Main process.

remarks.para: The library does not support all the possible Chromium switches, so there is no guarantee that the passed switches will work. The switches from this list will overwrite the corresponding options configured through the .
For example, if you configure the remote debugging port using the property and then add the --remote-debugging-port switch using the property, then the port from the switch will be used.

member.value: The path that will be used to store automatically generated Chromium crash dumps.

member.value: The Google client secret.

remarks.para: Some Chromium features such as Geolocation, Spelling, Speech, etc. use Google APIs, and to access those APIs, an API Key, OAuth 2.0 client ID, and client secret are required. Setting up API keys is optional. If you do not do it, the specific APIs using Google services won't work.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.GoogleTrafficDisabled
member.summary: Disables Chromium services that cause additional traffic, such as Google Cloud Messaging, Translate Ranker, Extensions Updater, Safe Browsing, etc. These services are related to the features that are not currently supported in DotNetBrowser.This option does not affect the supported features, such as SpellChecker or Widevine.
member.value: true if additional traffic is disabled, false otherwise.

remarks.para: By default, Chromium services that cause additional traffic are enabled.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.GpuDisabled
member.summary: Disables or enables GPU.
member.value: true if the GPU is disabled, false otherwise.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.IncognitoEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the incognito mode for the instance.
member.value: true if the incognito mode is enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: In the incognito mode the user data such as browsing history, cookies, site data, and the information entered in forms are stored in memory and released once you close the Engine.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the Chromium language that is used on the default error pages and message dialogs.
member.value: The Chromium language.

remarks.para: By default, the language is dynamically configured according to the default locale of the application. If the list of supported languages does not contain the language obtained from the application locale, then the US English language is used. This property allows you to override the default behavior and configure the Chromium engine with the given language.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key.
member.value: The license key.
member.remarks: The license key can be set via adding the "dotnetbrowser.license" file as embedded resource or individually for every using the property.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.PasswordStore
member.summary: Gets or sets the password store type which specifies the storage backend should be used to encrypt cookies.
member.value: The password store type.
member.remarks: If the password store type was not set, then the encryption storage backend is chosen by Chromium engine automatically.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.ProprietaryFeatures
member.summary: Gets or sets the proprietary features enabled for the instance. By default, all the proprietary features are disabled.
member.value: The proprietary features enabled for the instance.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.RemoteDebuggingPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the remote debugging port.
member.value: The remote debugging port.

remarks.para: This option enables remote debugging over HTTP at the specific port. When remote debugging is enabled, you can navigate to the http://localhost:<port> address from another Browser instance or from the Google Chrome browser and debug the loaded web pages using Chrome DevTools. If you use Google Chrome browser for remote debugging, its version must be equal to the Chromium engine version that is used in DotNetBrowser.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.RenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering mode indicating how the content of the web pages will be rendered.
member.value: The rendering mode.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.SandboxDisabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the sandbox.
member.value: true if the sandbox is disabled, false otherwise.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.Schemes
member.summary: Gets the dictionary of the schemes that will be intercepted.
member.value: The dictionary of the schemes that will be intercepted.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.TouchMenuDisabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the touch popup menu.
member.value: true if the touch popup menu is disabled, false otherwise.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom user agent string that is used to override the default user agent for the .
member.value: The custom user agent string.
member.remarks: This property has the same effect as adding the --user-agent switch.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.UserDataDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets an absolute path to the directory where the user data is stored.
member.value: An absolute path to the directory where the user data is stored.

remarks.para: The user data directory stores the data such as cache, cookies, history, GPU cache, local storage, visited links, web data, spell checking dictionary files, etc.
Important: the user data directory cannot be used at the same time by multiple instances running in a single or different applications.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Engine.EngineOptions.Builder.WebSecurityDisabled

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Engine.IEngine
member.summary: Provides access to the Chromium engine functionality.

remarks.para: To perform operations with the engine, a license key is required. The license key represents a string that can be set via the dotnetbrowser.license file or individually for every IEngine using the LicenseKey property. If you set the license key via configuring the license file, then please make sure that you set it before creating an IEngine instance.

The Chromium engine is running in a separate native process. Communication between the native and .NET process is done through the Inter-Process Communication (IPC) layer that allows transferring data between two processes on a local machine.

The native process allocates memory and system resources that must be released. So, when the engine is no longer needed, it must be disposed through the method to shutdown the native process and free all the allocated memory and system resources. For example:
Any attempt to use an already disposed engine or any of its services will lead to the .
To get notifications that the IEngine instance has been disposed subscribe to the following event:
To get notifications that the IEngine instance has been unexpectedly crashed use:

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Input.Keyboard.IKeyboard.KeyPressed

member.exception: The object has already been disposed.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Js.IJsFunction
member.summary: A JavaScript function that can be passed between .NET and JavaScript as a method argument or a return value. The function lifetime is bound to the lifetime of the frame this function belongs to. When the owner frame is unloaded, all the JavaScript objects are automatically disposed. An attempt to access a disposed JavaScript object will result in

remarks.para: This API is available since DotNetBrowser 2.1.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Js.IJsFunction.Invoke``1(DotNetBrowser.Js.IJsObject,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes the function on the given with the . This method blocks current thread execution until the function finishes its execution. If the function raises an exception, then a with an error message that describes the reason of the exception will be thrown. Same error message will be printed in JavaScript Console.
member.typeparam: The expected type of the result of the JavaScript function execution
member.param: .The JavaScript object to invoke this function on. Pass null to invoke the function as a global function.
The list of input arguments. The following types are supported: , , , , or .
member.returns: The result of the JavaScript function execution.
member.exception: The JavaScript function raised an exception.
The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Media.IMediaDevices.SelectMediaDeviceHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the web page asks which media input device should be used.

remarks.para: Use the to select a specific media input device.
If there are no media input devices of the requested type (e.g. there are no video input devices), then the callback will not be invoked).
Important: the engine will be blocked until you return control from the callback.
If the callback throws an exception or the returned media device is not the one from the , the system default media input device will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Navigation.INavigation.ShowHttpErrorPageHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the engine is about to display an error web page because the web server sends an empty HTTP response with the HTTP status code that represents an error.

remarks.para: Use to show the custom error page with the given HTML.
Use to display the default Chromium error page.
Important: the engine will be blocked until the Handle() method returns. It is not allowed to invoke any engine methods in the scope of this handler implementation.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Navigation.INavigation.ShowNetErrorPageHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the engine is about to display a network error web page because the required web resource cannot be loaded because of a network error.

remarks.para: Use to show the custom network error page with the given HTML.
Use to display the default Chromium network error page.
Important: the engine will be blocked until the Handle() method returns. It is not allowed to invoke any engine methods in the scope of this handler implementation.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Navigation.INavigation.StartNavigationHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used before the browser starts navigation to a resource.

remarks.para: Use to allow navigation start.
Use to ignore navigation request.
Important: the browser will be blocked until the Handle() method returns. It is not allowed to invoke any browser methods in the scope of this handler implementation.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Navigation.INavigation.LoadStarted
member.summary: Occurs when the content loading has been started. This event corresponds to the moment when the spinner of the tab starts spinning.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Navigation.INavigation.LoadFinished
member.summary: Occurs when the content loading has been finished. This event corresponds to the moment when the spinner of the tab stops spinning.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Navigation.INavigation.NavigationStarted
member.summary:
Occurs when the navigation has been started. This is also fired by same-document navigations, such as fragment navigations or pushState/replaceState, which will not result in a document change. To filter these out, use the property.
Note that more than one navigation can be ongoing in the same frame at the same time(including the main frame). Also, there is no guarantee that the will be fired for any particular navigation before this event is called on the next.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Navigation.INavigation.NavigationFinished

member.summary: Occurs when the navigation has been stopped.

member.name: E:DotNetBrowser.Navigation.INavigation.FrameDocumentLoadFinished

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Net.INetwork.AcceptLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the Accept-Language request header value.
member.remarks: This field restricts the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request. The default Accept-Language is "en-us". See W3 Documentation.
member.example: "fr, en-gb;q=0.8, en;q=0.7" would mean: "I prefer French, but will accept British English and other types of English." Note, that all languages which are assigned a quality factor greater than 0 are acceptable.
member.exception: The value is set to null or an empty string.
The object has already been disposed.
member.value: The Accept-Language value.

member.exception: The object has already been disposed.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.NetworkAccessDenied
member.summary: Permission to access the network was denied. This is used to distinguish errors that were most likely caused by a firewall from other access denied errors. See also ERR_ACCESS_DENIED.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.TemporarilyThrottled
member.summary: The request throttler module cancelled this request to avoid DDOS.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.HttpsProxyTunnelResponse
member.summary: A request to create an SSL tunnel connection through the HTTPS proxy received a non-200 = OK, and non-407 = Proxy Auth, response. The response body might include a description of why the request failed.

summary.para: We were unable to sign the CertificateVerify data of an SSL client auth handshake with the client certificate's private key.

Possible causes for this include the user implicitly or explicitly denying access to the private key, the private key may not be valid for signing, the key may be relying on a cached handle which is no longer valid, or the CSP won't allow arbitrary data to be signed.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.MsgTooBig
member.summary: The message was too large for the transport. = for example a UDP message which exceeds size threshold,.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.SpdySessionAlreadyExists
member.summary: A SPDY session already exists, and should be used instead of this connection.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.WsProtocolError
member.summary: Websocket protocol error. Indicates that we are terminating the connection due to a malformed frame or other protocol violation.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.ProtocolSwitched
member.summary: Connection was aborted for switching to another protocol. WebSocket abort SocketStream connection when alternate protocol is found.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.AddressInUse

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.SslPinnedKeyNotInCertChain
member.summary: The certificate didn't match the built-in public key pins for the host name. The pins are set in net/http/transport_security_state.cc and require that one of a set of public keys exist on the path from the leaf to the root.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.ClientAuthCertTypeUnsupported
member.summary: Server request for client certificate did not contain any types we support.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.OriginBoundCertGenerationTypeMismatch
member.summary: Server requested one type of cert, then requested a different type while the first was still being generated.

summary.para: The server responded with a certificate whose common name did not match the host name. This could mean:
1. An attacker has redirected our traffic to his server and is presenting a certificate for which he knows the private key.
2. The server is misconfigured and responding with the wrong cert.
3. The user is on a wireless network and is being redirected to the network's login page.
4. The OS has used a DNS search suffix and the server doesn't have a certificate for the abbreviated name in the address bar.
The server responded with a certificate that, by our clock, appears to either not yet be valid or to have expired. This could mean:
1. An attacker is presenting an old certificate for which he has managed to obtain the private key.
2. The server is misconfigured and is not presenting a valid cert.
3. Our clock is wrong.
The server responded with a certificate that is signed by an authority we don't trust. The could mean:
1. An attacker has substituted the real certificate for a cert that contains his public key and is signed by his cousin.
2. The server operator has a legitimate certificate from a CA we don't know about, but should trust.
3. The server is presenting a self-signed certificate, providing no defense against active attackers = but foiling passive attackers.
The server responded with a certificate that contains errors. This error is not recoverable.
MSDN describes this error as follows: "The SSL certificate contains errors." NOTE: It's unclear how this differs from ERR_CERT_INVALID. For consistency, use that code instead of this one from now on.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.CertNoRevocationMechanism
member.summary: The certificate has no mechanism for determining if it is revoked. In effect, this certificate cannot be revoked.

summary.para: Revocation information for the security certificate for this site is not available. This could mean:
1. An attacker has compromised the private key in the certificate and is blocking our attempt to find out that the cert was revoked.
2. The certificate is unrevoked, but the revocation server is busy or unavailable.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.CertRevoked
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate has been revoked. We have the capability to ignore this error, but it is probably not the thing to do.

summary.para: The server responded with a certificate that is invalid. This error is not recoverable.
MSDN describes this error as follows: "The SSL certificate is invalid."

member.summary: The server responded with a certificate that is signed using a weak signature algorithm.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.UnsafePort
member.summary: Attempting to load an URL with an unsafe port number. These are port numbers that correspond to services, which are not robust to spurious input that may be constructed as a result of an allowed web construct = e.g., HTTP looks a lot like SMTP, so form submission to port 25 is denied,.

member.name: F:DotNetBrowser.Net.NetError.DnsServerRequiresTcp
member.summary: DNS server requires TCP

summary.para: DNS server failed. This error is returned for all of the following error conditions:
1 - Format error - The name server was unable to interpret the query.
2 - Server failure - The name server was unable to process this query due to a problem with the name server.
4 - Not Implemented - The name server does not support the requested kind of query.
5 - Refused - The name server refuses to perform the specified operation for policy reasons.
