member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Net.Proxy.AutoDetectProxySettings
member.summary: With this proxy configuration the connection automatically detects proxy settings.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Net.Proxy.CustomProxySettings
member.summary: Describes a user's proxy settings.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Net.Proxy.CustomProxySettings.Exceptions
member.summary: The set of URLs that should bypass the proxy settings.
member.remarks:
The format of the exceptions string can be any of the following:
[ URL_SCHEME "://" ] HOSTNAME_PATTERN [ ":" <port> ] Examples: "foobar.com", "*foobar.com", "*.foobar.com", "*foobar.com:99", "https://x.*.y.com:99"
"." HOSTNAME_SUFFIX_PATTERN [ ":" PORT ] Examples: ".google.com", ".com", "http://.google.com"
[ SCHEME "://" ] IP_LITERAL [ ":" PORT ] Examples: "127.0.1", "[0:0::1]", "[::1]", "http://[::1]:99"
IP_LITERAL "/" PREFIX_LENGHT_IN_BITS Examples: "192.168.1.1/16", "fefe:13::abc/33"
"<local>" Match local addresses. The meaning of "<local>" is whether the host matches one of: "127.0.0.1", "::1", "localhost".
If you need to provide several exception rules you can separate them using comma: "*foobar.com,.google.com,<local>".

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Net.Proxy.CustomProxySettings.Rules
member.summary: The proxy rules in specified format. The string should be a semicolon-separated list of ordered proxies that apply to a particular URL scheme.
member.remarks:
Examples of the proxyRules string:
"http=foopy:80;ftp=foopy2" - use HTTP proxy "foopy:80" for http:// URLs, and HTTP proxy "foopy2:80" for %ftp:// URLs.
"foopy:80" - use HTTP proxy "foopy:80" for all URLs.
"socks4://foopy" - use SOCKS v4 proxy "foopy:1080" for all URLs.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Net.Proxy.CustomProxySettings.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new CustomProxySettings instance with given proxy rules.
member.param: string that represents proxy rules in specified format. The string should be a semicolon-separated list of ordered proxies that apply to a particular URL scheme.
string that represents the set of URLs that should bypass the proxy settings.
member.exception: Thrown when is null, empty or contain only white space.
member.remarks:
Examples of the proxy rules string:
"http=foopy:80;ftp=foopy2"use HTTP proxy "foopy:80" for http:// URLs, and HTTP proxy "foopy2:80" for %ftp:// URLs.
"socks4://foopy"use SOCKS v4 proxy "foopy:1080" for all URLs.

member.summary:
With this proxy configuration the connection uses proxy settings received from proxy auto-config (PAC) file which is located at the specific address.
In case PAC script fails, a direct connection will be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Plugins.IPlugins.AllowPluginHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets a handler that is used when the engine wants to check whether a specific plugin is allowed or not.
member.exception: The object has already been disposed.

remarks.para: Use the method to allow the plugin.
Use the method to deny the plugin.
If an exception occurs inside the handler implementation, the default behavior will be applied - the method will be used.
Important: the engine will be blocked until the callback response is sent. It is not allowed to invoke any engine/browser methods in this callback.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Plugins.IPluginSettings.PdfViewerEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the built-in PDF viewer.

remarks.para: This setting controls how DotNetBrowser handles navigations to web pages embedding PDF documents. When the PDF viewer is enabled, then the PDF document will be displayed in the PDF viewer. Otherwise, the engine will download the PDF document, like any other resource that cannot be rendered in the browser. The download can be configured via the .
Changing this setting affects only subsequent navigations and does not affect the already loaded web pages.
By default, the PDF viewer is enabled.

member.value: true if the PDF viewer is enabled, false otherwise.
member.exception: The connection to the Chromium engine is closed.

member.summary: Applies the configured print settings. You should call this method to regenerate the internal print preview using the configured settings and update the total page count to be printed.
member.remarks: This method is invoked automatically when you choose to proceed in the or . If the settings cannot be applied at this point, the printing operation is canceled.
member.exception: The print settings were not applied properly.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Search.ITextFinder.Find(System.String,DotNetBrowser.Search.FindOptions,DotNetBrowser.Handlers.IHandler{DotNetBrowser.Search.Handlers.FindResultReceivedParameters})
member.summary: Performs search of the given with the given , highlights all matches and selects the first match on the currently loaded web page.
member.param: the text to search. Cannot be null or empty.
the options such as direction and match case.
the handler which is called when some search results are received.
member.returns: a which completes when the search is finished. The result of the task is the last find result received from Chromium.
member.remarks: The search is performed only through a visible content on the loaded web page. If some text is presented on the web page, but due to CSS rules it's not visible, the text finder will not check this content during search. Also, it doesn't find text on the web pages with an empty size, so make sure that the size of the browser instance where the text search is performed isn't empty.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color
member.summary: A numeric model of an RGB color. The components of the color instance are presented in the arithmetic notation. This means that each component accepts any fractional value from 0 to 1.

remarks.para: If all the components except alpha are at zero and the alpha is at 1, the result is black. If all are at 1, the result is the brightest representable white.
Important: the component values out of the 0..1 range are not allowed and should not be used.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color.Alpha
member.summary: Gets the opacity channel value in the 0..1 range. When the value is 1, the color is 100% opaque. When 0, the color is 100% transparent.
member.value: The opacity channel value in the 0..1 range.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color.Blue
member.summary: Gets the blue channel value in the 0..1 range.
member.value: The blue channel value in the 0..1 range.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color.Green
member.summary: Gets the green channel value in the 0..1 range.
member.value: The green channel value in the 0..1 range.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color.Red
member.summary: Gets the red channel value in the 0..1 range.
member.value: The red channel value in the 0..1 range.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with the specified channel values.
member.param: The red channel value.
The green channel value.
The blue channel value.
The alpha channel value.
member.exception: thrown when any of the parameters is outside the 0..1 range.

remarks.para: The supported format strings are:

item.description: General string representation: Red: <value>, Green: <value>, Blue: <value>, Alpha: <value>

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color.ToHexRGB
member.summary: Creates a string representation for this color in the RGB hex format.
member.returns: The string representation for this color in the RGB hex format.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color.ToHexRGBA
member.summary: Creates a string representation for this color in the RGBA hex format.
member.returns: The string representation for this color in the RGBA hex format.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Ui.Color.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the value of this instance, according to the provided format specifier.
member.param: A single format specifier that indicates how to format the value of this Color. The format parameter can be "G", "F", "RGB", or "RGBA". If format is null or an empty string (""), "G" is used.
member.returns: The value of this , represented in the specified format.

remarks.para: The supported format strings are:

item.description: General string representation: Red: <value>, Green: <value>, Blue: <value>, Alpha: <value>

member.summary: Gets the new zoom level of a web page.
member.value: The new zoom level of a web page.

member.summary: Gets the instance associated with this object.
member.value: The instance associated with this object.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Zoom.IZoom
member.summary: Allows zooming content of a web page.
member.remarks:
A instance belongs to a instance and can be used only if the instance is alive. When the instance is closed, instance automatically updates its internal state and doesn't allow modifying zoom anymore. The will be thrown in this case.
The zoom level is configured for each domain separately, so if you set zoom level for the a.com web page, it will not be applied for the b.com web page. If you change zoom level for one domain and then load another one, then the zoom level for another domain will be default.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Zoom.IZoom.Browser
member.summary: Gets the instance associated with this object.
member.value: The instance associated with this object.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Zoom.IZoom.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables zoom changes.
member.value: true if zoom functionality is enabled, false otherwise.
member.remarks:
By default, zoom functionality is enabled. You can change zoom level for the currently loaded web page.
To disable zoom functionality, set this property to false. In this case, the browser instance will revert zoom to the default level, and all attempts to change zoom will be ignored.

member.name: P:DotNetBrowser.Zoom.IZoom.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom level for the currently loaded web page.
member.value: The zoom level.
member.remarks: Zoom level is configured for each domain separately. For example, if you load the www.a.com web page and set zoom level to , then load the www.b.org web page, the zoom level for www.b.org web page will be reset to default value. When you load the www.a.com web page again, its zoom level will be restored to automatically.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Zoom.IZoom.In
member.summary: Updates the zoom level for the currently loaded web page on one step up.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Zoom.IZoom.Out
member.summary: Updates the zoom level for the currently loaded web page on one step down.

member.name: M:DotNetBrowser.Zoom.IZoom.Reset
member.summary: Resets the zoom level for the currently loaded web page to default value.

member.name: T:DotNetBrowser.Zoom.Level
member.summary: A zoom level of a web page. Provides a set of the pre-defined constants. Each constant name consists of the P prefix followed by a number. The number represents a zoom level in percents. For example, the and values represent the 25% and 110% zoom levels accordingly.
